data.title: Movies Filmed in Colorado
data.meta_description: Complete list of movies filmed in Colorado. History & locations of films that were made in Denver, Colorado Springs, Boulder, Aspen, Telluride & Statewide.
data.text:
MOVIES MADE IN COLORADO

From Chaplin to Tarantino, notorious filmmakers have utilized Colorado’s endless variety of scenic filming locations throughout the years!

Below is a partial list of the more popular movies that have been filmed in Colorado in chronological order. Note that there are hundreds of other low budget movies, documentaries and short films that have been made in Colorado, that we were not able to include on this list. To see all of the film & video productions that have used Colorado as one of their locations, please visit IMDB’s list of Colorado made movies.

The Hateful Eight (2015)

Filming Location in Colorado: Telluride

The 8th feature film by Tarantino follows the story of several bounty hunters who are trying to survive during a terrible blizzard in 1870’s post Civil War Wyoming. The cast of “The Hateful Eight” includes Tarantino go to favorites Samuel Jackson (“Pulp Fiction”) Michael Madsen (Reservoir Dogs) as well as Kurt Russell, Channing Tatum, Tim Roth and Jennifer Jason Leigh.

Furious 7 (2015)

Filming Location in Colorado: Woodland Park, Pikes Peak Mtn.

This film marks the final appearance of actor Paul Walker as he stars together with Vin Diesel, Dwayne Johnson, and Jason Statham in the sequel to the Fast and Furious 6. Though filming was delayed midway through, Walker’s brothers were used as stand=ins and the film was successfully completed. After defeating competitors abroad in Tokyo Drift, Walker and Diesel return to the United States to face more challenges, dangers, and high voltage chase scenes.

Cop Car (2015)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado Springs

A small town sheriff sets out to find the two kids who have taken his car on a joy ride. Cast members include Kevin Bacon, Shea Whigham and Camryn Manheim.

Table 47 (2015)

Filming Location in Colorado: Castle Rock, Greenwood Village, Franktown

Directed by Jeff Kingery and written by Michael Brody, Table 47 is the first feature for Double Play Films, a Colorado company, and boasts an all Colorado cast and crew. In Table 47, a bar owner falls for a married woman with an abusive husband and plans to murder him, but soon discovers he’s the victim of an elaborate con…one he may not survive.

Out West (2014)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado

When discovering that her family has gone broke and must sell their Colorado ranch, Prissy Alcott must leave her posh life in Reno and return home in hopes of helping to rescue her family. Prissy enlists the help of her three gay friends, and with a little creative ingenuity converts the family’s Colorado home into a dude ranch to raise the much needed revenue.

An American Terror (2014)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

After being bullied mercilessly, a group of friends devise a plot to seek revenge on their bullies. The plot quickly takes a turn when the group happens upon an underground torture chamber, where they become trapped by a madman. Together they must use their strength and wiles to escape his sick confines in hopes of survival.

The Frame (2014)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

Two strangers find their lives colliding in an impossible way. Alex is a methodical cargo thief working for a dangerous cartel. Sam is a determined paramedic trying to save the world while running from her past.

Dear Eleanor (2014)

Filming Location in Colorado: Commerce City, Lyons, Niwot, Hygiene, Longmont, Denver

This coming of age story is about two teenage girls who travel across America in 1962 with the hope of meeting Eleanor Roosevelt during the Cuban missile crisis. The film was produced by Leonardo DiCaprio’s Appian Way Productions.

Identity Thief (2013)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

•• Mild mannered businessman Sandy Patterson travels from Denver to Florida to confront the deceptively harmless looking woman who has been living it up after stealing Sandy’s identity.

The Lone Ranger (2013)

Filming Location in Colorado: Creede

A Disney blockbuster film starring Johnny Depp and Armie Hammer, “The Lone Ranger” is the story of John Reid and Tonto, who join forces to find the infamous Butch Cavendish and bring him to justice. The story is told through the eyes of Tonto, who describes the adventures to a young boy throughout the story.

A Beer Tale (2012)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

This is the story of twin brothers who inherit their family’s brewery and seek to finish creating their family beer recipe. Despite family complications, the brothers continue in their quest, finding love and discovering who they truly wish to be as adults.

16-Love (2012)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

When Ally “Smash” Mash, the top junior tennis player in the United States, twists her ankle, her dreams of going pro take a turn for the worst. But when Ally meets an intriguing rival, their relationship changes her perspective and opens her heart to the prospect of love.

Broken Roads (2012)

Filming Location in Colorado: Brighton, Denver

When a teenager involved in a horrible car accident loses his mother, he must move to a tiny town to live with his estranged grandmother. While the two process their feelings of loss, they must learn to cope and mend their past by creating a new relationship together.

Darling Companion (2012)

Filming Location in Colorado: Telluride

“Darling Companion” stars Diane Keaton, Kevin Kline, and Dianne Wiest. This is the story of Beth, whose husband, Joseph, loses her beloved dog. Beth is determined to find it, though, and with the help of family and friends, she embarks on a journey to find her lost pet, discovering new relationships and mending old ones along the way.

Last Ounce of Courage (2012)

Filming Location in Colorado: Durango & Silverton Narrow Gauge Railway

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

The Frozen (2012)

Filming Location in Colorado: Snowmass, Carbondale

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

The Perfect Human Diet (2012)

Filming Location in Colorado: Fort Collins

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Mind’s Eye (2012)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

Mind’s Eye is a psychological thriller, a mind-bending film about Mattie Carver, a young high school musician who finds that space and time are collapsing around her, triggered by the resonant sound of her violin. Mattie is further confounded by the mysterious appearance of two shadowy men in black, who attempt to instruct her on the shifting nature of her perceptions.

Gathering of Heroes (2012)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Morrison, Blackhawk, Colorado Springs

In the mystical realm of Ryntia, the forces of the underworld are aligning to unleash a plague of evil upon the surface. The deadly bat-like Blood Reavers, the Saurian Maurauders, the Orcish Warmongers and the feline Shadow-cat mercenaries have pledged their respective clans to the service of Bre’Gwen, queen of the deep elves. Together they seek to destroy the human and Elven kingdoms and rule all of Ryntia in the name of evil.

Atlas Shrugged: Part I (2011)

Filming Location in Colorado: Royal Gorge

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Cougar Hunting (2011)

Filming Location in Colorado: Aspen

Three friends in their 20’s decide to travel to Aspen, Colorado to start dating the legendary “Cougars”- the sexy older women who have the money and power to fawn over younger men. Stars: Matt Prokop, Randy Wayne and Jillian Murray.

The Five (2010)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Littleton

Two different groups of kids – one group from the desert, and the other from the Colorado foothills, band together when they discover their lives are imitating the character from one of their favorite mythological books. On their adventure, they are pursued by a dark force that they are unaware of.

Fat, Sick & Nearly Dead (2010)

Filming Location in Colorado: Boulder

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Away We Go (2009)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado

•• A couple who is expecting their first child travel around the U.S. in order to find a perfect place to start their family. Along the way, they have misadventures and find fresh connections with an assortment of relatives and old friends who just might help them discover “home” on their own terms for the first time.

Ink (2009)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Crested Butte, Evergreen, Morrison

In a classic battle of good versus evil, two forces battle through peoples’ dreams, either providing optimism and happiness through good dreams or horror and sadness through nightmares. A father and his daughter are at the center of this battle, which they must win in order to save the daughter’s soul from an infinite nightmare.

Imagine That (2009)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

Eddie Murphy stars as a corporate executive who is at the end of his rope until his young daughter’s imaginary world provides him with the inspiration he needs to manage his career woes. With Eddie Murphy and Thomas Haden Church.

The City of Your Final Destination (2009)

Filming Location in Colorado: Boulder – University of Colorado

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Plastic Planet (2009)

Filming Location in Colorado: Paonia

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

The Lucky Ones (2008)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Grand Junction

This tale follows three Iraqi War veterans who return to the United States and embark on a road trip across the country. As the former soldiers bond, they also learn about themselves and the many obstacles that await them now that they’ve returned to their former lives. Starring: Rachel McAdams and Tim Robbins.

Enlighten Up! (2008)

Filming Location in Colorado: Boulder

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

The Sensei (2008)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Sterling

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

The Lodge (2008)

Filming Location in Colorado: Breckenridge

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Sicko (2007)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

“Sicko” is Michael Moore’s documentary concerning the health care industry around the world. It displays the greed and corruption within various health care systems, while also showing successful examples of other systems. Dir: Michael Moore.

Resurrecting the Champ (2007)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver – Denver Coliseum, Elway’s Restaurant

A young sports reporter (Josh Hartnett) helps a homeless man (Samuel L. Jackson) and discovers that he was a former heavy weight boxer with the nickname “Champ”. The reporter tries to bring Champ’s story to light as he also examines his own life and his relationship with his family.

Blades of Glory (2007)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver- Pepsi Center

Will Ferrel and “Napoleon Dynamite’s” Jon Heder star as dueling figure skating champions who have been banned from men’s individual figure skating. When they discover a loophole in the system, the two join together as partners to compete as the first male/male figure skating team. Starring: Will Ferrell, Jon Heder, Amy Poehler

The Shadow Walkers (2007)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

Shadow Walkers is a highly suspenseful story of a group of lab technicians and military personnel who awaken in a subterranean laboratory with no memory of who they are. They quickly discover that they are sealed in, with only one way to get out alive. They must travel deeper into the underground facility to an escape tunnel that leads to the surface. Hindered by the fact there is only limited electrical power, they struggle through the darkness where they uncover a hive of genetically mutated creatures that stalk them from the shadows.

Last of the Romantics (2007)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Skills Like This (2007)

Filming Location in Colorado: Boulder, Arvada, Denver

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Return of the Ghostbusters (2007)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

The Surfer King (2006)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Water World

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Jesus Camp (2006)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado Springs

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Fast Food Nation (2006)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado Springs

As the marketing director of Mickey’s fast food restaurant chain’s, Don Anderson goes to a slaughterhouse in Colorado in order to examine the accusation that there is cow feces in his burgers. Through his investigation he discovers how corrupt the fast food industry really can be. Stars: Greg Kinnear, Bruce Willis.

Catch and Release (2006)

Filming Location in Colorado: Boulder – Pearl Street Mall

Jennifer Garner stars as a woman whose husband dies unexpectedly and must piece her life back together with the help of her friends. Along the way she gets to know her husband’s childhood friend Fritz, a womanizer, but as she gets to know Fritz more and more, she finds herself strangely falling for him. Starring: Jennifer Garner, Timothy Olyphant and Kevin Smith.

The Prestige (2006)

Filming Location in Colorado: Telluride, Durango – Silverton Railway Line

Robert Angier is a magician in London whose wife, Julia, dies accidentally by being his assistant in a performance. Robert blames his assistant Alfred Borden for her death and the two become enemies who attempt to sabatoge one another’s performances. Starring Christian Bale, Hugh Jackman and Scarlett Johansson.

Mr. & Mrs. Smith (2005)

Filming Location in Colorado: Glenwood Canyon

Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie star as Mr. and Mrs. Smith, two secret assassins who are unaware of each other’s occupation until they suddenly become the target of one another.

Back Slash (2005)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Longmont

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Silver City (2004)

Filming Location in Colorado: Idaho Springs, Sedalia, Leadville, Denver

Candidate Dicky Pilager becomes involved in discovering a corpse while he is taping an environmental political ad for his campaign. Pilager hires detective Danny O’Brien to investigate the situation, and Danny soon learns that Pilager is involved in a complicated web of deceit. Dir: John Sayles – With: Chris Cooper, Thora Birch and Maria Bello.

Winter Break (2003)

Filming Location in Colorado: Aspen

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

The Laramie Project (2002)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Golden

This is the story of Matthew Shepard, a high school student who was brutally murdered in a small Wyoming town for being homosexual. Stars: Christina Ricci, Steve Buscemi, Peter Fonda.

Bowling for Columbine (2002)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Littleton

Michael Moore directs this documentary that explores the widespread gun ownership in the United States and its violent results. Dir: Michael Moore – Starring: Michael Moore, Charlton Heston, Marilyn Manson.

About Schmidt (2002)

Filming Location in Colorado: Boulder, Denver

Warren Schmidt (Jack Nicholson) is a man who faces retirement and must come to terms with the relationships in his life. He goes on a journey across the Midwest in an RV to attend his estranged daughter’s wedding in Denver and finds humor and many realizations about himself along the way. Starring: Jack Nicholson and Hope Davis.

Dragon and the Hawk (2001)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

Korean martial arts master teams up with US police detective to solve the mystery of his missing sister. Their search leads to a sinister underworld organization that they must battle their way through.

The Claim (2000)

Filming Location in Colorado: Durango & Silverton Narrow Gauge Railway

••• A prospector sells his wife and daughter to another gold miner for the rights to a gold mine. Twenty years later, the prospector is a wealthy man who owns much of the old west town named Kingdom Come. But changes are brewing and his past is coming back to haunt him. A surveyor and his crew scout the town as a location for a new railroad line and a young woman suddenly appears in the town and is evidently the man’s daughter.

Ride (2000)

Filming Location in Colorado: Breckenridge, Keystone, Steamboat Springs

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Nurse Betty (2000)

Filming Location in Colorado: Durango

Renee Zellweger stars as a waitress who becomes delusional after seeing her husband murdered. She starts to believe that she is the former fiance of a soap opera star and goes to LA to find him. As she makes her journey her husband’s murderer’s pursue her, and Morgan Freeman joins in tracking her down. Starring: Renée Zellweger, Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock.

Raising the Stakes (1999)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Fifty (1999)

Filming Location in Colorado: Breckenridge, Vail

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

For Love of the Game (1999)

Filming Location in Colorado: Aspen, Glenwood Springs

•• A washed up pitcher flashes through his career.

Strangeland (1998)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado Springs, Denver

When Genevive Gage and her best friend Tiana Moore get involved with a fellow teenager they meet through the internet, they decide to accept his invitation to a party at his house. But their new internet friend, Captain Howdy, has dark intentions for the pair of teenage girls. Genevive’s father, Mike Gage, is a local cop who tries to find his daughter and her friend before it is too late.

Three Ninjas: High Noon at Mega Mountain (1998)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

Three young boys, Rocky, Colt and Tum Tum together with their neighbor girl, computer whiz Amanda are visiting Mega Mountain amusement park when it is invaded by an army of ninjas led by evil Medusa, who wants to take over the park and hold the owners for ransom. Kids and retired TV star Dave Dragon, who made his farewell appearance at the park at the time the ninjas appeared, have to break Medusa’s vicious plans.

Phantoms (1998)

Filming Location in Colorado: Georgetown, Denver

In this strange thriller, 150 people have been killed and 350 people are missing in the small mountain town of Snowfield, Colorado. A group of people set out to destroy the evil force that has decimated their population.

Freeriders (1998)

Filming Location in Colorado: Aspen, Steamboat Springs, Winter Park

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

The Hi-Lo Country (1998)

Filming Location in Colorado: Pritchett

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Everest (1998)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado

••• An international team of climbers ascends Mt. Everest in the spring of 1996. The film depicts their lengthy preparations for the climb, their trek to the summit, and their successful return to Base Camp. It also shows many of the challenges the group faced, including avalanches, lack of oxygen, treacherous ice walls, and a deadly blizzard.

Snowriders II (1997)

Filming Location in Colorado: Aspen, Breckenridge, Vail, Winter Park

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Switchback (1997)

Filming Location in Colorado: Pinecliffe, Denver – Pink Pig

F.B.I agent Frank LaCrosse finds himself desperately pursuing the killer of his son’s babysitter who also kidnapped his son. The murder matches those of a serial killer who has been killing victims for almost two years. Frank must find this killer before he murders another victim or Frank loses his son forever.

The Shining – TV Mini-Series (1997)

Filming Location in Colorado: Arvada, Denver, Estes Park – Stanley Hotel

Stephen King wrote both the novel and the teleplay for this creepy film where a writer/professor who is also a recovering alcoholic agrees to become the caretaker of a Colorado hotel in the dead of winter. Though he is joined by his wife and son, the family soon finds itself becoming more and more isolated, and the professor seems to be dealing with some evil forces that he is helpless to protect himself or his family against.

Asteroid – TV Movie (1997)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver – University Hills Mall

This film follows several characters as they prepare themselves for the inevitable fate that awaits them when an incoming asteroid threatens to destroy their lives.

Larger Than Life (1996)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

When Jack Corcoran’s father passes away, he leaves Jack with an unconventional inheritance; an elephant. Jack’s father was a circus performer, and the elephant was his pride and joy. Now Jack finds himself on a journey across the country with this elephant, and the experience changes Jack’s life forever.

The Fan (1996)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver – Coors Field

When Bobby Rayburn (Wesley Snipes) joins the San Francisco Giants, his obsessive fan (Robert DeNiro) is thrilled. But when Rayburn plays the worst season of his baseball career, his life soon takes a turn for the worse when his fan attempts to help him.

Independence Day (1996)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado Springs – Peterson Air Force Base

When a large alien spacecraft destroys New York, Los Angeles, and Washington on July 3rd, the survivors come up with a plan to fight back against the aliens. On July 4th the remaining humans use their best efforts to destroy these aliens in an effort to save the human race.

The Sunchaser (1996)

Filming Location in Colorado: Ouray

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Tall Tale (1995)

Filming Location in Colorado: Carbondale, Glenwood Springs

•••A young boy draws on the inspiration of legendary western characters to find the strength to fight an evil land baron in the old west who wants to steal his family’s farm and destroy their idyllic community. Legends such as Pecos Bill, Paul Bunyan, John Henry and Calamity Jane battle together in this flick.

Things to Do in Denver When You’re Dead (1995)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver- Union Station

When Jimmy the Saints business of videotaping people who are near death give advice to their survivors begins to fail, he turns towards some loan sharks for help. Jimmy soon learns that this is a mistake that might cost his fortune as well as his life.

Under Siege 2: Dark Territory (1995)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Glenwood Springs, Leadville, Pinecliffe

When Casey Ryback takes his niece of a trip from Denver to Los Angeles, the train is taken hostage by Dane, who uses the train as a control center to take over a super weapon he designed for the government before he was fired.

The Stand – Mini-Series (1994)

Filming Location in Colorado: Boulder, Colorado Springs – Garden of the Gods

Only a few survivors remain after most of the world is destroyed by a government made deadly virus. The survivors, who band together, begin having dreams about two forces representing good and evil and find themselves forced to make a decision on which side they will stand up for and who they will fight against.

Dumb & Dumber (1994)

Filming Location in Colorado: Aspen, Breckenridge, Copper Mountain, Estes Park

Jim Carrey and Jeff Danels play Harry and Lloyd, two extremely stupid friends who travel across the country in an attempt to return a suitcase full of money to its rightful owner.

Wyatt Earp (1994)

Filming Location in Colorado: Antonito

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Lightning Jack (1994)

Filming Location in Colorado: Canon City – Buckskin Joe Frontier Town & Railway

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

White Fang 2 (1994)

Filming Location in Colorado: Aspen

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

In the Line of Fire (1993)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver – Civic Center Park

Clint Eastwood stars as Frank Horrigan, a secret service agent who was in charge of protecting President Kennedy when he was assassinated. Now, years later, a clever and dangerous former CIA assassin (John Malkovich) is threatening to kill the current president. Will Horrigan be able to protect the President now that he has a second chance?

Cannibal, The Musical (1993)

Filming Location in Colorado: Lake City, Gunnison, Boulder, Canon City, Ouray

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Aspen Extreme (1993)

Filming Location in Colorado: Aspen

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Cliffhanger (1993)

Filming Location in Colorado: Durango, Rocky Mountains

Gabe (Sylvester Stallone) is plagued by the memory of his friend’s death, who literally slips out of his hands and to falls to the ground while they are crossing a ledge. But a year later, Gabe finds himself being asked to rescue a group of lost people in the mountains and must face his fears and his memories. John Lithgow plays the villain in this adrenaline filled, suspenseful film.

Arizona Dream (1992)

Filming Location in Colorado: Gunnison

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Baraka (1992)

Filming Location in Colorado: Mesa Verde National Park

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Ladybugs (1992)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Littleton

In order to impress his boss and move upward in his company, Chester Lee (Rodney Dangerfield) decides to coach his employee daughters soccer team. He uses his fiance’s son in order to ensure the success of his new soccer team.

Thelma & Louise (1991)

Filming Location in Colorado: Gateway, Bedrock

In this film about friendship and loyalty, Louise (Susan Sarandon) and Thelma (Geena Davis) decide to take a road trip in order to escape from their dull and challenging lives. But when a man threatens to rape Thelma, Louise kills him, and before they know it, the pair find themselves being hunted by the police.

City Slickers (1991)

Filming Location in Colorado: Durango

Billy Crystal plays a middle aged salesman who is facing a mid life crisis along with his friends Ed and Phil. The group decides to take a trip to the west to drive cattle from New Mexico to Colorado, and along the way they meet Curly (Jack Palance, who earned an Academy Award for his role in the film) who teaches them many important life lessons.

Fast Getaway (1991)

Filming Location in Colorado: Royal Gorge

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Conagher (1991)

Filming Location in Colorado: Canon City – Buckskin Joe Frontier Town & Railway

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Flashback (1990)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Glenwood Springs

John Buckner is an FBI agent who brings Huey Walker to jail for crimes committed in the 60’s. But when Walker tricks Buckner on a train, the pair fall into the hands of refugees who they must escape from together.

Die Hard 2 (1990)

Filming Location in Colorado: Breckenridge, Mead, Denver – Stapleton Airport

John McClane (Bruce Willis) finds himself in another horrifying situation in which a group of terrorists are holding an entire airport hostage. The terrorists take control of the airplanes, as well, so that no runway lights are working, therefore forcing airplanes with limited fuel to remain in the air.

The Adventures of Ford Fairlane (1990)

Filming Location in Colorado: Morrison

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Big Bad John (1990)

Filming Location in Colorado: Trinidad

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)

Filming Location in Colorado: Alamosa, Cortez, Pagosa Springs, Cumbres & Toltec Railroad in Antonito

Indiana Jones embarks on an adventure to find both “The Holy Grail” and his father, Dr. Henry Jones Sr. (Sean Connery), who is also searching for the Grail. Together, the two fight the Nazis as well as many other obstacles in order to reach it.

The Forgotten One (1989)

Filming Location in Colorado: Echo Lake

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Elves (1989)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado Springs

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Christmas Vacation (1989)

Filming Location in Colorado: Breckenridge

Chevy Chase stars again as Clark Griswold, whose family Christmas Celebration turns into a disaster as he tries to entertain and accommodate his challenging family guests.

Messenger of Death (1988)

Filming Location in Colorado: Fruita, Glenwood Springs

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Everybody’s All-American (1988)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver – Mile High Stadium

•• A Louisiana football legend struggles to deal with life’s complexities after his college career is over.

Action Jackson (1988)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

Over the Top (1987)

Filming Location in Colorado: Ouray

Sylvester Stallone stars as Lincoln Hawk, a trucker who attempts to amend his relationship with his estranged teenage son after his mother dies. Together the pair embark on a journey across the United States to Las Vegas, where Hawk signs up to be a part of an arm wrestling competition with very high stakes.

The Legend of Billie Jean (1985)

Filming Location in Colorado: Copper Mountain, Curtain Ponds

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

American Flyers (1985)

Filming Location in Colorado: Boulder, Grand Junction

Portions of this film were shot in Colorado. A short description of this movie is coming soon. Please check back at a later date.

The Philadelphia Experiment (1984)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver

A United States Navy Destroyer Escort in 1943 disappears from the Philadelphia Harbor only to find himself launched into the future in 1984. This film is based off of an event that took place during World War II.

Starman (1984)

Filming Location in Colorado: Friuta, Denver

John Carpenter directs this film about Jenny Hayden, a young widow whose life takes an interesting turn when she encounters an alien, named Starman, who takes the form of her deceased husband and then kidnaps her.

WarGames (1983)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado Springs – Cheyenne Mountain Complex

Mork & Mindy – TV Series (1978 -1982)

Filming Location in Colorado: Boulder

Robin Williams plays Mork, an alien who is sent to Earth in order to gather data for his home planet. Mork moves in with Mindy, and he is constantly perplexed by human behavior. The show provides a unique glimpse into Williams’ unique and talented skills in acting and comedy at the beginning of his career.

Every Which Way But Loose (1978)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Aurora, Georgetown

Philo Beddoe is a trucker and fist fighter who has two best friends; Orville and Clyde, an orangutan he won in a bet. Along their journey the threesome are pursued by a gang of bikers.

One on One (1977)

Filming Location in Colorado: Fort Collins

Badlands (1973)

Filming Location in Colorado: Delhi, La Junta, Las Animas, Pueblo, Rocky Ford

“Badlands” is based off of the true story of Charles Starweather and Caril-Ann Fugate, who murdered Fugues family and went on a killing spree shortly afterward. Kit Carruthers (Martin Sheen) sweeps Holly Sargis (Sissy Spacek) off of her feet with his James Dean-like charm. When Holly’s family criticizes their relationship, the two kill her family and then set out towards the Badlands of Montana, where they continue to murder anyone who crosses their path.

Vanishing Point (1971)

Filming Location in Colorado: Denver, Glenwood Springs, Rifle

In this cult hit from the early 70’s, a car delivery man named Kowalski gets involved in a bet that he can take a 1970 Dodge Challenger from Colorado to San Francisco in less than 15 hours. Along the way he encounters a blind DJ and the two are chased by the highway patrol. The film’s adventurous and odd characters make it an interesting, must-see classic.

True Grit (1969)

Filming Location in Colorado: Cañon City, Castle Rock, Gunnison, Montrose, Ouray, Ridgway

After her father is brutally murdered, Mattie Ross vows to avenge her fathers death by hiring a rough and tumble marshal “Rooster” Cogburn, played by John Wayne who won an Academy Award for the role in 1970. Throughout their journey they encounter a Texas Ranger who is searching for the same man, and Mattie and Cogburn form a strong and unlikely bond.

The Gold Rush (1925)

Filming Location in Colorado: Colorado, USA

Charlie Chaplin plays a lonely gold digger in search of his fortune in the Alaskan wilderness. Along his adventures he comes across some tough looking characters, as well as a woman who attracts all of his love and attention. Written, directed and starred in by Charles Chaplin, some say this was the film he most wanted to be remembered for.
